Rotate for fullscreen

Your browser doesn't support HTML5 video.

sections.doc_:
## Introduction

Use [`amp-video`](/amp-dev/documentation/components/reference/amp-video-v0.1.md) to embed videos into your AMP HTML files. Video source files must be served via HTTPS.
sections.cachedMarkedDoc:
Introduction

Use amp-video to embed videos into your AMP HTML files. Video source files must be served via HTTPS.
sections.normalizedDoc_:
## Introduction

Use [`amp-video`](/amp-dev/documentation/components/reference/amp-video-v0.1.md) to embed videos into your AMP HTML files. Video source files must be served via HTTPS.

sections.code:
<script async src="https://cdn.ampproject.org/v0.js"></script>
<link rel="canonical" href="http://localhost:8080/documentation/examples/components/amp-video/index.html">
<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width,minimum-scale=1,initial-scale=1">
<style amp-boilerplate>body{-webkit-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;-moz-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;-ms-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both}@-webkit-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-moz-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-ms-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-o-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}</style><noscript><style amp-boilerplate>body{-webkit-animation:none;-moz-animation:none;-ms-animation:none;animation:none}</style></noscript>
</head>
<body>

sections.doc_: A simple video with controller. `amp-video` supports the following formats: mp4, webm, ogg together with all the formats supported by the HTML5 video tag including HLS.
sections.code: Your browser doesn't support HTML5 video.
sections.preview: Your browser doesn't support HTML5 video.
sections.normalizedDoc_: A simple video with controller. `amp-video` supports the following formats: mp4, webm, ogg together with all the formats supported by the HTML5 video tag including HLS.

sections.doc_:
Setting `autoplay` will automatically play/pause the video as it is
scrolled into/out of view on supported browsers.

The video is automatically muted before autoplay starts, when the user
taps the video, the video is unmuted.

If the user has interacted with the video
(e.g., mutes/unmutes, pauses/resumes, etc.), and the video is scrolled in
or out of view, the state of the video remains as how the user left it.
sections.code: Your browser doesn't support HTML5 video.
sections.preview: Your browser doesn't support HTML5 video.
sections.normalizedDoc_:
Setting `autoplay` will automatically play/pause the video as it is
scrolled into/out of view on supported browsers.

The video is automatically muted before autoplay starts, when the user
taps the video, the video is unmuted.

If the user has interacted with the video
(e.g., mutes/unmutes, pauses/resumes, etc.), and the video is scrolled in
or out of view, the state of the video remains as how the user left it.

sections.doc_:
AMP supports adaptive bitrate video via
[HLS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP_Live_Streaming) provided it is
supported by the browser. (Note that whilst HLS is supported by most mobile
browsers—including Chrome and Safari—few desktop browsers support it.)

The videos below have the bitrate burnt into the video files themselves to
make it easier to discover when the browser switches between streams. If
your browser does not support HLS, you will see "No HLS". If you need to
create files in the appropriate format, we recommend investigating
[shaka packager](https://github.com/google/shaka-packager).
sections.code: Your browser doesn't support HTML5 video.
sections.preview: Your browser doesn't support HTML5 video.
sections.normalizedDoc_:
AMP supports adaptive bitrate video via
[HLS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP_Live_Streaming) provided it is
supported by the browser. (Note that whilst HLS is supported by most mobile
browsers—including Chrome and Safari—few desktop browsers support it.)

The videos below have the bitrate burnt into the video files themselves to
make it easier to discover when the browser switches between streams. If
your browser does not support HLS, you will see "No HLS". If you need to
create files in the appropriate format, we recommend investigating
[shaka packager](https://github.com/google/shaka-packager).

sections.doc_: With the implementation of the MediaSessionAPI on AMP, you can now show rich notifications that describe the playing media through the `artist`, `album`, `artwork` and `title` attributes. Learn more by following [this tutorial](/documentation/examples/multimedia-animations/rich_media_notifications/).
sections.code:
<amp-video autoplay
  src="https://commondatastorage.googleapis.com/gtv-videos-bucket/sample/BigBuckBunny.mp4"
  poster="https://peach.blender.org/wp-content/uploads/bbb-splash.png"
  artwork="img/bigbuckbunny.jpg"
  title="Big Buck Bunny"
  album="Blender"
  artist="Blender Foundation"
  width="720"
  height="405"
  layout="responsive"
  controls>
</amp-video>
sections.preview:
<amp-video autoplay
    src="https://commondatastorage.googleapis.com/gtv-videos-bucket/sample/BigBuckBunny.mp4"
    poster="https://peach.blender.org/wp-content/uploads/bbb-splash.png"
    artwork="img/bigbuckbunny.jpg"
    title="Big Buck Bunny"
    album="Blender"
    artist="Blender Foundation"
    width="720"
    height="405"
    layout="responsive"
    controls>
  </amp-video>
sections.normalizedDoc_: With the implementation of the MediaSessionAPI on AMP, you can now show rich notifications that describe the playing media through the `artist`, `album`, `artwork` and `title` attributes. Learn more by following [this tutorial](/documentation/examples/multimedia-animations/rich_media_notifications/).

sections.doc_:
Setting `rotate-to-fullscreen` will automatically show the video on
fullscreen when the user rotates their device into landscape mode, if it's
playing manually and visible.

See a [more advanced example](/advanced/video_rotate_to_fullscreen_with_hint/) for displaying a user hint signaling that the device
can be rotated to enter fullscreen.
sections.code:
Rotate for fullscreen

Your browser doesn't support HTML5 video.
sections.preview:
Rotate for fullscreen

Your browser doesn't support HTML5 video.
sections.normalizedDoc_:
Setting `rotate-to-fullscreen` will automatically show the video on
fullscreen when the user rotates their device into landscape mode, if it's
playing manually and visible.

See a [more advanced example](/advanced/video_rotate_to_fullscreen_with_hint/) for displaying a user hint signaling that the device
can be rotated to enter fullscreen.

document.head:
<meta charset="utf-8">
  <title>amp-video</title>
  <script async custom-element="amp-video" src="https://cdn.ampproject.org/v0/amp-video-0.1.js"></script>
  <script async src="https://cdn.ampproject.org/v0.js"></script>
  <link rel="canonical" href="http://localhost:8080/documentation/examples/components/amp-video/index.html">
  <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width,minimum-scale=1,initial-scale=1">
  <style amp-boilerplate>body{-webkit-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;-moz-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;-ms-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both}@-webkit-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-moz-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-ms-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-o-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}</style><noscript><style amp-boilerplate>body{-webkit-animation:none;-moz-animation:none;-ms-animation:none;animation:none}</style></noscript>
